query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 ‘Al Padre, al Figlio, a lo Spirito Santo’, 2 cominciò, ‘gloria!’, tutto ’l paradiso, 3 sì che m’inebrïava il dolce canto.
query.error: **English:** 1 “To the Father, to the Son, to the Holy Spirit,” 2 began, “glory!”, all of paradise, 3 so that the sweet song intoxicated me.
query.result: 1 “Dhe’n Tas, dhe’n Mab, dhe’n Spyrys Sans”, 2 A dhallethas, “glôr!”, oll an baradwys, 3 Yn poynt henna an kan milis a wra’m meudhi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
4 Ciò ch’io vedeva mi sembiava un riso 5 de l’universo; per che mia ebbrezza 6 intrava per l’udire e per lo viso.
query.error: **English:** 4 What I saw seemed to me a smile 5 of the universe; because my intoxication 6 entered through my hearing and through my sight.
query.result: 4 An peth a welov a semlasov rydh, 5 A’n bys oll; rag an vy dhewedh 6 A dheuth drefen gans klevos ha golwg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Oh gioia! oh ineffabile allegrezza! 8 oh vita intègra d’amore e di pace! 9 oh sanza brama sicura ricchezza!
query.error: **English:** 7 Oh joy! Oh ineffable gladness! 8 Oh life complete in love and peace! 9 Oh secure wealth without desire!
query.result: 7 O lowena! O lowena diworth! 8 O bywans leun a garow ha hedh! 9 O pinwer dhegys heb awen!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Dinanzi a li occhi miei le quattro face 11 stavano accese, e quella che pria venne 12 incominciò a farsi più vivace,
query.error: **English:** 10 Before my eyes the four torches 11 stood alight, and the one that came first 12 began to grow brighter,
query.result: 10 Raglys y’m golwg an peswar flamm 11 A seuf, ha’n onan a dheuth kyns 12 A dhallethas dhe wul dhe vos kreski,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 e tal ne la sembianza sua divenne, 14 qual diverrebbe Iove, s’elli e Marte 15 fossero augelli e cambiassersi penne.
query.error: **English:** 13 and in its appearance it became 14 like Jove would become, if he and Mars 15 were birds and exchanged their feathers.
query.result: 13 Ha kepar henna y’n semlans 14 Ytho Iov, pub sodho ef ha Mars 15 A vydh evnedh ha chanjya aga pluv.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 La provedenza, che quivi comparte 17 vice e officio, nel beato coro 18 silenzio posto avea da ogne parte,
query.error: **English:** 16 Providence, which here apportions 17 office and duty, in the blessed choir 18 had imposed silence on every side,
query.result: 16 An ragprovidans, ow rannja yma 17 Rann ha dyth, y’n kor benigys 18 A wra posys tavell war bob tu,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
19 quand’ ïo udi’: «Se io mi trascoloro, 20 non ti maravigliar, ché, dicend’ io, 21 vedrai trascolorar tutti costoro.
query.error: **English:** 19 when I heard: “If I change color, 20 do not be amazed, because, as I speak, 21 you will see all these others change color.
query.result: 19 Pan glewasov: “Pub treylyav vy, 20 Na ve dhymmorth, rag, a leverov, 21 Yma hwans treylyav oll an dusma.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Quelli ch’usurpa in terra il luogo mio, 23 il luogo mio, il luogo mio, che vaca 24 ne la presenza del Figliuol di Dio,
query.error: **English:** 22 He who usurps my place on earth, 23 my place, my place, which is empty 24 in the presence of the Son of God,
query.result: 22 An hini a wra’n ow le powyth war an nor, 23 Ow le powyth, ow le powyth, ow tyller 24 Raglys Presens an Mab a Dhew,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 fatt’ ha del cimitero mio cloaca 26 del sangue e de la puzza; onde ’l perverso 27 che cadde di qua sù, là giù si placa».
query.error: **English:** 25 has made of my cemetery a sewer 26 of blood and stench; by which the perverse one 27 who fell from up here is appeased down there.
query.result: 25 A wra gwreys ow mynwent yn klodhyow 26 A wos ha breus; dre henna an drog 27 A gwythas a-dhyworth hemma, a wra lowenys y’n isel.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Di quel color che per lo sole avverso 29 nube dipigne da sera e da mane, 30 vid’ ïo allora tutto ’l ciel cosperso.
query.error: **English:** 28 Of that color which, because of the sun opposite, 29 a cloud paints in the evening and in the morning, 30 I saw then all of heaven covered.
query.result: 28 A’n liw henna, ow poynt an howl owth, 29 Glaw a livr war an ser ha’n beure, 30 Ytho vyth ow tos oll an nef cospersys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
31 E come donna onesta che permane 32 di sé sicura, e per l’altrui fallanza, 33 pur ascoltando, timida si fane,
query.error: **English:** 31 And like a virtuous lady who remains 32 sure of herself, and because of another’s fault, 33 even while listening, grows timid,
query.result: 31 Ha kepar benenes onest owth a wra 32 Sygur a-droy, ha dre falans an aral, 33 Pub sodho ow klevos, owth a wra ow thas,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 così Beatrice trasmutò sembianza; 35 e tale eclissi credo che ’n ciel fue 36 quando patì la supprema possanza.
query.error: **English:** 34 so Beatrice changed countenance; 35 and I believe that such an eclipse occurred in heaven 36 when the supreme power suffered.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Poi procedetter le parole sue 38 con voce tanto da sé trasmutata, 39 che la sembianza non si mutò piùe:
query.error: **English:** 37 Then her words proceeded 38 with a voice so changed from itself 39 that her appearance did not change any more:
query.result: 37 Wosa henna a dheuth war-lergh, 38 Gans leun kemmys ow chanjya a-droy, 39 Yn poynt henna an semlans na wra chanjys moy:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 «Non fu la sposa di Cristo allevata 41 del sangue mio, di Lin, di quel di Cleto, 42 per essere ad acquisto d’oro usata;
query.error: **English:** 40 “The bride of Christ was not raised 41 with my blood, with Linus’s, with Cletus’s, 42 to be used for the acquisition of gold;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 ma per acquisto d’esto viver lieto 44 e Sisto e Pïo e Calisto e Urbano 45 sparser lo sangue dopo molto fleto.
query.error: **English:** 43 but for the acquisition of this joyful life 44 Sixtus and Pius and Callistus and Urban 45 shed their blood after much weeping.
query.result: 43 Mes rag dhe vos usys dhe’n bywans ma 44 Sixtus ha Pius ha Callistus ha Urban 45 A wra skwathya aga gwydh wosa moy a dhegor.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Non fu nostra intenzion ch’a destra mano 47 d’i nostri successor parte sedesse, 48 parte da l’altra del popol cristiano;
query.error: **English:** 46 It was not our intention that on the right hand 47 some of our successors should sit, 48 and some on the other, of the Christian people;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 né che le chiavi che mi fuor concesse, 50 divenisser signaculo in vessillo 51 che contra battezzati combattesse;
query.error: **English:** 49 nor that the keys that were given to me 50 should become a sign on a banner 51 that would fight against the baptized;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 né ch’io fossi figura di sigillo 53 a privilegi venduti e mendaci, 54 ond’ io sovente arrosso e disfavillo.
query.error: **English:** 52 nor that I should be a figure on a seal 53 for privileges sold and false, 54 at which I often blush and burn with shame.
query.result: 52 nagas vy dhe veu dhe furv war sel 53 rag prevylyjyow gwerthys ha fals, 54 drefen aga wra vy dhe gochya ha loski yn fenowgh.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 In vesta di pastor lupi rapaci 56 si veggion di qua sù per tutti i paschi: 57 o difesa di Dio, perché pur giaci?
query.error: **English:** 55 Instead of shepherds, ravenous wolves 56 are seen from up here in all the pastures: 57 O defense of God, why do you lie still?
query.result: 55 Yn le anviles pastores, bleizi laer 56 a weler a-dhyworth pub paska: 57 O difens a Dhew, peragis ow tos?

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Del sangue nostro Caorsini e Guaschi 59 s’apparecchian di bere: o buon principio, 60 a che vil fine convien che tu caschi!
query.error: **English:** 58 Cahorsins and Gascons are preparing 59 to drink our blood: O good beginning, 60 to what vile end must you fall!
query.result: 58 Kowrsedhyn ha Gwaskonyon a brepar 59 dhe yva ni gwav: O dalleth da, 60 dhe pes fin vil rydh dhe dhrehedha!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
61 Ma l’alta provedenza, che con Scipio 62 difese a Roma la gloria del mondo, 63 soccorrà tosto, sì com’ io concipio;
query.error: **English:** 61 But the high providence, which with Scipio 62 defended Rome, the glory of the world, 63 will come to our aid soon, as I conceive;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 e tu, figliuol, che per lo mortal pondo 65 ancor giù tornerai, apri la bocca, 66 e non asconder quel ch’io non ascondo».
query.error: **English:** 64 and you, my son, who for the mortal burden 65 will return down below, open your mouth, 66 and do not hide what I do not hide.
query.result: 64 ha thow, ow mab, neb rag an boes ughel 65 a dheth dhe'n bys a-dhia, gorra dhow geno, 66 ha na gemm an peth na wra ow kemma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Sì come di vapor gelati fiocca 68 in giuso l’aere nostro, quando ’l corno 69 de la capra del ciel col sol si tocca,
query.error: **English:** 67 Just as flakes of frozen vapor 68 fall down through our air, when the horn 69 of the goat of heaven touches the sun,
query.result: 67 Avelsa dowr jelys a-dhoredh 68 yn-nans an ayr ni, pan vo an horn 69 a’n gavr a’n oabl a dheghowr an howl,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 in sù vid’ io così l’etera addorno 71 farsi e fioccar di vapor trïunfanti 72 che fatto avien con noi quivi soggiorno.
query.error: **English:** 70 up above I saw the ether adorned 71 and made to snow with triumphant vapors 72 that had made their dwelling here with us.
query.result: 70 yn-nans owth welas an eter addurnys 71 hag ow tos yn dowr gans dowrow tremengy 72 neb a wre dha obera genen gans ni.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Lo viso mio seguiva i suoi sembianti, 74 e seguì fin che ’l mezzo, per lo molto, 75 li tolse il trapassar del più avanti.
query.error: **English:** 73 My sight followed their forms, 74 and followed until the middle, because of the multitude, 75 took away their passing any further.
query.result: 73 Ow golwg ow sewyas y aga semlantys, 74 ha sewyas bys dhe’n kres, rag an moyth, 75 a gemeras dheth dhe drehedha pella.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Onde la donna, che mi vide assolto 77 de l’attendere in sù, mi disse: «Adima 78 il viso e guarda come tu se’ vòlto».
query.error: **English:** 76 Whereupon the lady, who saw me freed 77 from looking up, said to me: “Turn your gaze 78 and see how you are turned.”
query.result: 76 Pan welas an benen ow dasserghys 77 a bredery yn-nans, hi a leveris dhym: 78 “Treylya dhow golwg ha gweles pyth yw dhow troys.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Da l’ora ch’ïo avea guardato prima 80 i’ vidi mosso me per tutto l’arco 81 che fa dal mezzo al fine il primo clima;
query.error: **English:** 79 From the hour that I had first looked 80 I saw myself moved throughout the arc 81 that the first clime makes from the middle to the end;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
82 sì ch’io vedea di là da Gade il varco 83 folle d’Ulisse, e di qua presso il lito 84 nel qual si fece Europa dolce carco.
query.error: **English:** 82 so that I saw beyond Cadiz the mad voyage 83 of Ulysses, and on this side, near the shore, 84 where Europa made herself a sweet burden.
query.result: 82 kepar owth welas a-dhyworth Gades an fordh 83 fol a Ulisses, ha’n-nans, ogas an arvor, 84 le may Europa ow tos karga dowr.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 E più mi fora discoverto il sito 86 di questa aiuola; ma ’l sol procedea 87 sotto i mie’ piedi un segno e più partito.
query.result: 85 Ha moy a vydh dyskudhys an le 86 a’n eyl-ma, mes an howl a drehedhas 87 a-woles ow treys merk ha moy rannys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 La mente innamorata, che donnea 89 con la mia donna sempre, di ridure 90 ad essa li occhi più che mai ardea;
query.error: **English:** 88 My enamored mind, which always gives 89 itself to my lady, burned with desire 90 to see her more than ever;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 e se natura o arte fé pasture 92 da pigliare occhi, per aver la mente, 93 in carne umana o ne le sue pitture,
query.error: **English:** 91 and if nature or art ever made 92 a pasture to capture the eyes, in order to possess the mind, 93 in human flesh or in its paintings,
query.result: 91 ha pan vo natur po art a wrug 92 pastur dhe gemeres an golwgys, rag dhe gemeres an meyn, 93 yn kig denel po yn y adhyskansow,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 tutte adunate, parrebber nïente 95 ver’ lo piacer divin che mi refulse, 96 quando mi volsi al suo viso ridente.
query.error: **English:** 94 all of them together would seem as nothing 95 compared to the divine pleasure that shone on me 96 when I turned to her smiling face.
query.result: 94 pub tra ow tos ow kemeres, y fydhsen nans yw 95 dhe’n pleser divin neb a dhegodhas dhym, 96 pan owth trehedhas dhe’n fas rydhysi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
97 E la virtù che lo sguardo m’indulse, 98 del bel nido di Leda mi divelse, 99 e nel ciel velocissimo m’impulse.
query.error: **English:** 97 And the power that granted me its gaze 98 drew me out of the beautiful nest of Leda, 99 and propelled me into the swift heaven.
query.result: 97 Ha’n nerth a roos dhym y golwg, 98 a’m diwiskas a neyth byw Leda, 99 ha’m gwaskas yn-nans an oabl a-dhia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
100 Le parti sue vivissime ed eccelse 101 sì uniforme son, ch’i’ non so dire 102 qual Bëatrice per loco mi scelse.
query.error: **English:** 100 Its living and lofty parts 101 are so uniform that I cannot say 102 which Beatrice chose for me as a place.
query.result: 100 Y rannensow byw ha ughel 101 yw kemmys unfurvys, kepar na wra owth gallos 102 py le Bëatrice a dhewis dhym avel le.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
103 Ma ella, che vedëa ’l mio disire, 104 incominciò, ridendo tanto lieta, 105 che Dio parea nel suo volto gioire:
query.error: **English:** 103 But she, who saw my desire, 104 began, laughing so joyously 105 that God seemed to rejoice in her face:
query.result: 103 Mes hynwys, neb a welas ow dysyr, 104 a dhallethas, owth chwerthin kemmys lowen, 105 kepar vo Dhew ow lowenja yn y fas:

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 «La natura del mondo, che quïeta 107 il mezzo e tutto l’altro intorno move, 108 quinci comincia come da sua meta;
query.error: **English:** 106 “The nature of the world, which quiets 107 the middle and moves all the rest around it, 108 begins here as from its goal;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 e questo cielo non ha altro dove 110 che la mente divina, in che s’accende 111 l’amor che ’l volge e la virtù ch’ei piove.
query.error: **English:** 109 and this heaven has no other where 110 than the divine mind, in which is kindled 111 the love that turns it and the power that it rains down.
query.result: 109 ha’n oabl-ma na wra le erel 110 mes an meyn divin, yn neb a dhegodh 111 an karow a’n trehedh ha’n nerth a wra yth tewlel.”

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Luce e amor d’un cerchio lui comprende, 113 sì come questo li altri; e quel precinto 114 colui che ’l cinge solamente intende.
query.error: **English:** 112 Light and love of a circle comprehend him, 113 just as this one the others; and that boundary 114 only he who encircles it understands.
query.result: 112 Golowhagkarantegykelli a gomprehendaf, 113 keparhaghowma'ganer;hagnagprecynk 114 an ke a wra'n a wravyth yn unnik.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
115 Non è suo moto per altro distinto, 116 ma li altri son mensurati da questo, 117 sì come diece da mezzo e da quinto;
query.error: **English:** 115 Its motion is not distinguished by anything else, 116 but the others are measured by this, 117 just as ten by half and by fifth;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
118 e come il tempo tegna in cotal testo 119 le sue radici e ne li altri le fronde, 120 omai a te può esser manifesto.
query.error: **English:** 118 and how time holds its roots in such a text 119 and its branches in the others, 120 can now be clear to you.
query.result: 118 ha kepar an amser a wra gwitha yma'n testen 119 yma'n gwreydhyow ha'n erel yma'n frondow, 120 ow a wra kler dhe'th yw awos.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
121 Oh cupidigia che i mortali affonde 122 sì sotto te, che nessuno ha podere 123 di trarre li occhi fuor de le tue onde!
query.error: **English:** 121 O greed, that so drowns mortals 122 beneath you that no one has the power 123 to pull their eyes out of your waves!
query.result: 121 O kowetha hag a wra'n an veygh marow 122 a-woles dhe'th, na'th onan a wra gallus 123 dhe'th dreha y golgow dhyworth y tonnow!

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
124 Ben fiorisce ne li uomini il volere; 125 ma la pioggia continüa converte 126 in bozzacchioni le sosine vere.
query.error: **English:** 124 The will flourishes in men, 125 but the constant rain turns 126 the true blossoms into worthless buds.
query.result: 124 An volons a wra florya y'n tus an dus, 125 mes an glav kesson a wra troha 126 an bleujyow gwir yn bozzakyonow diwerth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
127 Fede e innocenza son reperte 128 solo ne’ parvoletti; poi ciascuna 129 pria fugge che le guance sian coperte.
query.error: **English:** 127 Faith and innocence are found 128 only in little children; then each one 129 flees before their cheeks are covered.
query.result: 127 Feth ha dileyth a wra kavos 128 yn unnik an dus vyghan; wosa henna 129 pub onan a wra'n foga na'ga wra y dhewyn gwoles.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
130 Tale, balbuzïendo ancor, digiuna, 131 che poi divora, con la lingua sciolta, 132 qualunque cibo per qualunque luna;
query.error: **English:** 130 Such a one, still babbling, fasts, 131 then devours, with loosened tongue, 132 any food in any month;
query.result: 130 Henwys, ow balbyjya hwath, a wra junya, 131 wosa henna a wra divorra, gans an taves lettys, 132 pub boos rag pub mis.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
133 e tal, balbuzïendo, ama e ascolta 134 la madre sua, che, con loquela intera, 135 disïa poi di vederla sepolta.
query.error: **English:** 133 and such a one, babbling, loves and listens to 134 his mother, who, with perfect speech, 135 then desires to see him buried.
query.result: 133 Ha henwys, ow balbyjya, a wra kara ha klevva 134 y vam, hag, gans lavara per feth, 135 a wra dysya wosa henna dhe'y gweles medhys.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
136 Così si fa la pelle bianca nera 137 nel primo aspetto de la bella figlia 138 di quel ch’apporta mane e lascia sera.
query.error: **English:** 136 Thus the white skin becomes black 137 at the first sight of the beautiful daughter 138 of him who brings morning and leaves evening.
query.result: 136 Henwys y wra'n an croen gwyn yn du 137 y'n kynsa golwg a'y vergh vyw 138 a'n ke a wra'n owthynna myttyn ha ow hedha an goweth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
139 Tu, perché non ti facci maraviglia, 140 pensa che ’n terra non è chi governi; 141 onde sì svïa l’umana famiglia.
query.error: **English:** 139 You, so that you do not marvel, 140 consider that on earth there is no one who governs; 141 whence the human family goes so astray.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
142 Ma prima che gennaio tutto si sverni 143 per la centesma ch’è là giù negletta, 144 raggeran sì questi cerchi superni,
query.error: **English:** 142 But before January is all turned to winter 143 by the hundredth part that is neglected down there, 144 these supernal circles will so revolve,
query.result: 142 Mes kyns henna Genver oll a wra troys dhe'n gwav 143 rag an kansvesves a wra neglettys ena, 144 an kelkow ma'n sirklow supern,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
145 che la fortuna che tanto s’aspetta, 146 le poppe volgerà u’ son le prore, 147 sì che la classe correrà diretta;
query.error: **English:** 145 that Fortune, who is so awaited, 146 will turn the sterns where the prows are, 147 so that the fleet will run straight;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
148 e vero frutto verrà dopo ’l fiore».
query.error: **English:** 148 and true fruit will come after the flower.
query.result: 148 ha gwir frooth a wra dhe'n bleujyn.
